Posts.Content: Dear Elaine, Often times, the pain comes from hormonal changes before and during one's period. Usually, breast cancer is painless. That being said, I strongly recommend consulting with a physician to have the breast pain evaluated by a professional. You didn't give your age, history of family breast cancer, history of breast feeding, birth control pills, number of pregnancies, live births, that will be helpful to further assess the risk. You will need a breast exam, mammogram, and possibly an ultrasound for the evaluation. Best regards, Merry Juliana Report Reply
Posts.Title: can pain in breast be a sign of cancer?

Posts.Content: I have developed pain in soft breast tissue in one breast, could this be a sign of cancer? 0 likes, 6 replies Report
Posts.Title: can pain in breast be a sign of cancer?

Posts.Content: Hello Merry I am 53, well out of menopause and my sister died of brest cancer a good few years ago. i have 2 children and did take the pill for around 5 years. i also took hrt for around 5 years until recently. i saw doc this morning and i asked if it could be a sympton and he said, "i dont know" i have had blood trsts that are due back this week and hoping for some answers. i have read online that in some cases it has presented as just pain. i had a mommo a year ago and was clear then. Elaine Report Reply
